firstOctave.title: First Octave
firstOctave.description: The lower the value, the smoother the changes in altitude will be, making biome edges smoother.

amplitudes.title: Amplitudes
amplitudes.description: A list of floats. Using more values allows for greater precision. Higher absolute values seem to make the altitude reach greater absolute values.

dimensionType.title: Minecraft Data Pack Dimension Type
dimensionType.description: Configuration file defining a dimension type for a data pack for Minecraft.

name.title: Name
name.description: The resource location used for the dimension type.

ultrawarm.title: Ultrawarm
ultrawarm.description: Whether the dimensions behaves like the nether (water evaporates and sponges dry) or not. Also lets stalactites drip lava and causes lava to spread faster and thinner.

natural.title: Natural
natural.description: When true, nether portals can spawn zombified piglins. When false, compasses spin randomly, and using a bed to set the respawn point or sleep, is disabled.

coordinate_scale.title: Coordinate Scale
coordinate_scale.description: The multiplier applied to coordinates when traveling to the dimension.

has_skylight.title: Has Skylight
has_skylight.description: Whether the dimension has skylight access or not.

has_ceiling.title: Has Ceiling
has_ceiling.description: Whether the dimension has a bedrock ceiling or not.

ambient_light.title: Ambient Light
ambient_light.description: How much light the dimension has.

fixed_time.title: Fixed Time
fixed_time.description: If this is set to a number, the time of the day is the specified value.

piglin_safe.title: Piglin Safe
piglin_safe.description: Whether piglins shake and transform to zombified piglins.

bed_works.title: Bed Words
bed_works.description: When false, the bed blows up when trying to sleep.

respawn_anchor_works.title: Respawn Anchor Works
respawn_anchor_works.description: Whether players can charge and use respawn anchors.

has_raids.title: Has Raids
has_raids.description: Whether players with the Bad Omen effect can cause a raid.

logical_height.title: Logical Height
logical_height.description: The maximum height to which chorus fruits and nether portals can bring players within this dimension. This excludes portals that were already built above the limit as they still connect normally.

min_y.title: Minimum Y
min_y.description: The minimum height in which blocks can exist within this dimension.

height.title: Height
height.description: The total height in which blocks can exist within this dimension.

infiniburn.title: Infiniburn
infiniburn.description: A resource location defining what block tag to use for infiniburn.

effects.title: Effects
effects.description: Determines the dimension effect used for this dimension.

description: Configuration file defining a dimension for a data pack for Minecraft.

type.title: Type
type.description: The namespaced ID of the dimension type.

generator.title: Generator
generator.description: Generation settings used for that dimension.

items.description: A superflat layer. The first entry is the bottom layer, the last entry is the top layer.

height.title: Height
height.description: The number of blocks in the layer.

block.title: Block
block.description: The block the layer is made of.

biome.title: Biome
biome.description: The single biome of the world.

lakes.title: Lakes
lakes.description: Whether or not to generate lakes. If set to true, then water and lava lakes generate often even in biomes where lakes don't normally generate. Lava lakes generate surrounded by different types of stone and ores from the overworld.

features.title: Features
features.description: Whether or not to generate biome-specific decorations like trees, grass, flowers, cacti, etc.

stronghold.title: Stronghold
stronghold.description: Settings for how strongholds should be spawned.

distance.title: Distance
distance.description: Controls how far apart the strongholds are.

structures.title: Structures
structures.description: Map of structures to use in this dimension.

spacing.title: Spacing
spacing.description: Average distance between two structure placement attempts of this type in chunks.

seperation.title: Seperation
seperation.description: Minimum distance between two structures of this type in chunks; must be less than spacing.

salt.title: Salt
salt.description: A number that assists in randomization.

seed.title: Seed
seed.description: The seed used to generate the dimension. In most cases, this is exactly the same as the world seed, but can be different and the dimension generated is based upon this seed and not the world seed.

settings.title: Settings
settings.description: The noise settings used in the terrain generator. Can be set to a string to use a preset defined in the worldgen/noise_settings folder with a list of customized options.

biome_source.title: Biome Source
biome_source.description: Settings dictating which biomes and biome shapes.

seed.title: Seed
seed.description: The seed used for biome generation.

biomes.title: Biomes
biomes.description: A list of biome IDs to generate.

then.description: Default and large biome generation used in the overworld.
A biome generation in which biomes are square (or close to square) and repeat along the diagonals.

biomes.title: Biomes
biomes.description: A list of biomes that repeat along the diagonals.

scale.title: Scale
scale.description: Determines the size of the squares on an exponential scale.

then.description: 3D biome generation used in the nether.

altitude_noise.title: Altitude Noise
altitude_noise.description: How the altitude parameter is spread in the world.

weirdness_noise.title: Weirdness Noise
weirdness_noise.description: Similar to altitude_noise for the weirdness parameter.

temperature_noise.title: Temperature Noise
temperature_noise.description: Similar to altitude_noise for the temperature parameter.

humidity_noise.title: Humidity Noise
humidity_noise.description: Similar to altitude_noise for the humidity parameter.

preset.title: Preset
preset.description: A preset of the set of biomes to be used.

biomes.title: Biomes
biomes.description: A list of biomes, including their likelihood.

parameters.title: Parameters
parameters.description: Represent optimal conditions for where the biome should be placed. These values do not affect the generation of terrain within biomes; they affect where the game chooses to place biomes.

altitude.title: Altitude
altitude.description: Used to place similar biomes near each other.

weirdness.title: Weirdness
weirdness.description: Defines how weird the biome is going to appear next to other biomes.

offset.title: Offset
offset.description: Similar to the other parameters but offset is 0 everywhere, thus setting this parameter nearer to 0 gives the biome a greater edge over others, all else being equal.

temperature.title: Temperature
temperature.description: Used to place similar biomes near each other. This is NOT the same as the temperature value listed on Biome, it does NOT affect rain/snow or the color of leaves and grass.

humidity.title: Humidity
humidity.description: Used to place similar biomes near each other.

then.description: Biome generation used in the end with biome minecraft:the_end in the center and other end biomes around.

title: Minecraft Data Pack Dimension
